title: Runnin' Down a DREAM
body_text:
Many encounters have been termed "dream matches", but perhaps never has that description been more fitting than it is now. It's amazing that arguably the two most respected, decorated stars have gone all these
years
without ever meeting. But at DODGEBALL C30, the idea of the "dream" became an ultimate reality.
And so it goes ... iconic southpaw
Kevin Megill
, legendary powerhouse
Chris Adams
- undoubtedly one of the biggest confrontations on the SuperBowl stage!
MATCH SUMMARY
One had to question if either man would ever be the same following such a masterpiece of mayhem - the inaugural round of this seven game series all the evidence needed. The show-stealing performance from Megill's DODGEBALL 80 adversary-turned-teammate Mike Edwards allowed Megill to gain the first point of the match.
The momentum carried throughout the next hour of play, with the flame-throwing left-hander extending the lead to 3. With a firm grip on the contest, could Megill close out the remaining portion of DODGEBALL C30 to his benefit?
The Megill-lead massacre, as strong and powerful as imagined, would be temporarily halted by an Adams onslaught in Game 4. Backed by dynamite first choice Grant Cornero, rim-smacking Mike Butler, and future season finale headliner Juan Londono, the eldest of the Adams clan physically assaulted his resilient enemies to finally get on the board. But "The Axe's" equally fearsome foe wasn't finished just yet.
"I'm Captain, and we can't lose!", exclaimed a highly-motivated Megill in an attempt to reenergize and refocus his pack of predators. And refocus indeed. With time quickly winding down, the former 14-year powerhouse pitcher regrouped from the minor setback and steadily climbed atop the mountain known as DODGEBALL C30.
Flash Results by Game
... Megill: 1, 2, 3, 5, 6; Adams: 4, 7
Kevin Megill
successfully fought off the forces of
Chris Adams
, 5 to 2, at the 130th
EastCoastDodgeball
spectacular.
Warriors that exited the Wall High School battlegrounds couldn't help but notice the cracks on 18th Avenue - the collision between Megill and Adams jostled the very foundations of the earth! What an absolutely brutal, physically scarring altercation!
Mike "Sputz" Krott
left DODGEBALL C30 with a streak of pride a mile wide and some dough - $11 to be exact! The catching phenom himself outlasted ten other competitors in the sport's first
MoneyMaker
Rimshot Contest, defeating runner-up Juan Londono in the final round.
Full list of entries into this pregame competition: Bobby Vetrano, Chris Adams, Diana DiBuccio, Grant Cornero, Joe Kelly, John Tronolone, Juan Londono, Melissa Kerr, Mike "Sputz" Krott, Ryan Letsche, and Travis Mills.
SEASON 13
-->
Butler vs. Butler
, Lauren Winston and Grant Cornero
CREAMated
, and ALL's destruction of WALL were just some of the highlights over the past 10-week program.
--> This 13th Season generated an average attendance of 22.4 and produced a record-low 9 new players.
--> DODGEBALL 125 and DODGEBALL 128 were the only
Wet Wars
. It should also be noted that DODGEBALL 128 was a
Snow War
as well.
--> Diana DiBuccio, Juan Londono, and John Tronolone attended every Season 13 event, spanning from DODGEBALL 121 in mid-January to the March 15th finale DODGEBALL C30.
DODGEBALL C30
--> Most would agree the decorations for DODGEBALL C30 were rather ... interesting. Streamers stretched several yards from various points of the court, the
Star Rims
were hung just for the hell of it, and two 70-foot clotheslines some 10 feet in the air seemingly served no purpose. It looked like a war zone even before C30 officially began! At least there were Christmas lights.
--> The C30 Soundtrack was organized by female titans Diana DiBuccio and Melissa Kerr and featured a mix of rock, rap, and dance themes, specifically from the
Jock Jams
CD.
--> The first-ever
MoneyMaker
Rimshot Contest is just one of several different variations of the popular pregame. Mike "Sputz" Krott ended up the sole survivor of this one, walking out of DODGEBALL C30 $11 richer.
--> First Pick for Kevin Megill:
John Tronolone
--> First Pick for Chris Adams:
Grant Cornero
DODGEBALL 131 Announcement - shocking DODGEBALL 140 Revelation!
Travis Mills and Kristen Driscoll team up to take on Valerie Winston, Sascha Basista, and John Tronolone in a 2 vs. 3
CREAMation Rules
encounter, one week before they all leave for WrestleMania XXIV! It all goes down March 22!
DODGEBALL 140 comes to live May 31, and never before has a season's main attraction been established prior to its start! Regardless,
EastCoastDodgeball
is overly thrilled to give you this:
Justin Wolf
vs.
Juan Londono
at the Season 14 Conclusion!
It's a ten event for goodness sake - just some of the happenings guaranteed you'll never forget!
--> The Game 1, one on one showdown between Mike Edwards and soon-to-be season finale headliner Juan Londono.
--> Captain Chris Adams wrapped in white streamers.
--> Captain Kevin Megill hitting rim when needed in Game 1 and accidentally in Game 2.
--> Michelle Mullins kicking ass and taking names.
--> The returning Chris Daly, not surprisingly to those that know him, participating barefoot. Captain Adams was also without footwear at one point during the night.
--> A slew of combatants dancing to the many hip-hop and dance songs.
--> Luke Frazza delivering some free goodies!
--> Grant Cornero missing a 20 foot lob from Mike Edwards.
--> Ryan Letsche's incredible string of front line blocks and dodges during Game 6.
--> Mike "Sputz" Krott falling backward after catching a rifled bulletball from John Tronolone.
--> Travis Mills receiving two nutshots; one from opponent Melissa Kerr and the other from teammate Justin Wolf during
Prison Ball
.
Attendance of DODGEBALL C30 was
30
, comprised of 19 men and 11 women.
New Players
included John Cusic, Anthony Fossani, and Bianca Basilone.
DODGEBALL C30 welcomed back several of
EastCoastDodgeball's
finest talents: Alysha Kelly (previous DB 42); Joe Kelly (previous DB LX3); Jason Teitelbaum (previous DB 102); Chris Daly (previous DB 119); Kathryn Nogueira (previous CXX); Sara DeCuir (previous DB 122)
DODGEBALL C30 was the fourth season finale extravaganza held on the Front Courts of Wall High School. This was largely due to the continuing tennis lights failure.
The month of March has hosted 3 season finales; more than other time of the year. DODGEBALL 30 took place on March 12, 2006, while last year's DODGEBALL 80 was held on St. Patrick's Day on the 17th.
The official theme song was "Runnin' Down a Dream" by Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers.
DODGEBALL C30 was just the third ten event to feature a
Rimshot Contest
of any kind. DODGEBALL 50 in the Summer of 2006 and DODGEBALL LX from October of that year also featured the special pregame competition.
The captains for this milestone event were legendary figures Kevin Megill and Chris Adams. This was the first meeting between the two, despite each competing in over 100 events.
..
Kevin Megill
made his third season finale captains appearance, having headlined DODGEBALL 30 and DODGEBALL 80 [both held in the month of March]. He leaves C30 with an overall 6-1-1 record, having become only the third competitor in history to reach six total victories.
..
Chris Adams
also made his third season finale captains appearance, having headlined DODGEBALL 50 and DODGEBALL 70. He leaves C30 with an overall 6-6-0 record, having become the first competitor in history to lead a team into battle 12 times.
Alysha Kelly was the only competitor of the total 30 to have never competed in a ten event.
John Tronolone is now the sole combatant to participate in all 13 season finales. Kevin Adams had the streak of 12 going, but wound up missing DODGEBALL C30 due to his senior class trip.
DODGEBALL C30 not only ended the 13th ten-week program, but the Winter 2007/2008 season as well. The sport will head in to its third Spring beginning with DODGEBALL 131 on March 22.
C30 Soundtrack
Special
Thanks!
to both Melissa Kerr and Diana DiBuccio for the work they put forth towards the red hot playlist.
The Atmosphere
Nearly everyone in attendance helped out in setting up and taking down the decorations.
Thank You
all!
Now That Winter is Over ...
To everyone who participated or simply watched in awe,
Thanks!
for making this time period one of the most exciting ever! Over two and a half years later and we're still going strong!
The 130th EastCoastDodgeball extravaganza ... what did you think?
A: Trust me, I'll be back.
B: A fun time all-around.
C: Some moments here and there.
D: More negatives than positives.
E: I'd rather visit the dentist.
body_html:
Many encounters have been termed "dream matches", but perhaps never has that description been more fitting than it is now. It's amazing that arguably the two most respected, decorated stars have gone all these years without ever meeting. But at DODGEBALL C30, the idea of the "dream" became an ultimate reality.

And so it goes ... iconic southpaw Kevin Megill, legendary powerhouse Chris Adams - undoubtedly one of the biggest confrontations on the SuperBowl stage!

MATCH SUMMARY
One had to question if either man would ever be the same following such a masterpiece of mayhem - the inaugural round of this seven game series all the evidence needed. The show-stealing performance from Megill's DODGEBALL 80 adversary-turned-teammate Mike Edwards allowed Megill to gain the first point of the match.

The momentum carried throughout the next hour of play, with the flame-throwing left-hander extending the lead to 3. With a firm grip on the contest, could Megill close out the remaining portion of DODGEBALL C30 to his benefit?

The Megill-lead massacre, as strong and powerful as imagined, would be temporarily halted by an Adams onslaught in Game 4. Backed by dynamite first choice Grant Cornero, rim-smacking Mike Butler, and future season finale headliner Juan Londono, the eldest of the Adams clan physically assaulted his resilient enemies to finally get on the board. But "The Axe's" equally fearsome foe wasn't finished just yet.

"I'm Captain, and we can't lose!", exclaimed a highly-motivated Megill in an attempt to reenergize and refocus his pack of predators. And refocus indeed. With time quickly winding down, the former 14-year powerhouse pitcher regrouped from the minor setback and steadily climbed atop the mountain known as DODGEBALL C30.

Flash Results by Game ... Megill: 1, 2, 3, 5, 6; Adams: 4, 7

Kevin Megill successfully fought off the forces of Chris Adams, 5 to 2, at the 130th EastCoastDodgeball spectacular.

Warriors that exited the Wall High School battlegrounds couldn't help but notice the cracks on 18th Avenue - the collision between Megill and Adams jostled the very foundations of the earth! What an absolutely brutal, physically scarring altercation!


Mike "Sputz" Krott left DODGEBALL C30 with a streak of pride a mile wide and some dough - $11 to be exact! The catching phenom himself outlasted ten other competitors in the sport's first MoneyMaker Rimshot Contest, defeating runner-up Juan Londono in the final round.

Full list of entries into this pregame competition: Bobby Vetrano, Chris Adams, Diana DiBuccio, Grant Cornero, Joe Kelly, John Tronolone, Juan Londono, Melissa Kerr, Mike "Sputz" Krott, Ryan Letsche, and Travis Mills.


SEASON 13
--> Butler vs. Butler, Lauren Winston and Grant Cornero CREAMated, and ALL's destruction of WALL were just some of the highlights over the past 10-week program.
--> This 13th Season generated an average attendance of 22.4 and produced a record-low 9 new players.
--> DODGEBALL 125 and DODGEBALL 128 were the only Wet Wars. It should also be noted that DODGEBALL 128 was a Snow War as well.
--> Diana DiBuccio, Juan Londono, and John Tronolone attended every Season 13 event, spanning from DODGEBALL 121 in mid-January to the March 15th finale DODGEBALL C30.

DODGEBALL C30
--> Most would agree the decorations for DODGEBALL C30 were rather ... interesting. Streamers stretched several yards from various points of the court, the Star Rims were hung just for the hell of it, and two 70-foot clotheslines some 10 feet in the air seemingly served no purpose. It looked like a war zone even before C30 officially began! At least there were Christmas lights.
--> The C30 Soundtrack was organized by female titans Diana DiBuccio and Melissa Kerr and featured a mix of rock, rap, and dance themes, specifically from the Jock Jams CD.
--> The first-ever MoneyMaker Rimshot Contest is just one of several different variations of the popular pregame. Mike "Sputz" Krott ended up the sole survivor of this one, walking out of DODGEBALL C30 $11 richer.
--> First Pick for Kevin Megill: John Tronolone
--> First Pick for Chris Adams: Grant Cornero

DODGEBALL 131 Announcement - shocking DODGEBALL 140 Revelation!
Travis Mills and Kristen Driscoll team up to take on Valerie Winston, Sascha Basista, and John Tronolone in a 2 vs. 3 CREAMation Rules encounter, one week before they all leave for WrestleMania XXIV! It all goes down March 22!

DODGEBALL 140 comes to live May 31, and never before has a season's main attraction been established prior to its start! Regardless, EastCoastDodgeball is overly thrilled to give you this: Justin Wolf vs. Juan Londono at the Season 14 Conclusion!


It's a ten event for goodness sake - just some of the happenings guaranteed you'll never forget!
--> The Game 1, one on one showdown between Mike Edwards and soon-to-be season finale headliner Juan Londono.
--> Captain Chris Adams wrapped in white streamers.
--> Captain Kevin Megill hitting rim when needed in Game 1 and accidentally in Game 2.
--> Michelle Mullins kicking ass and taking names.
--> The returning Chris Daly, not surprisingly to those that know him, participating barefoot. Captain Adams was also without footwear at one point during the night.
--> A slew of combatants dancing to the many hip-hop and dance songs.
--> Luke Frazza delivering some free goodies!
--> Grant Cornero missing a 20 foot lob from Mike Edwards.
--> Ryan Letsche's incredible string of front line blocks and dodges during Game 6.
--> Mike "Sputz" Krott falling backward after catching a rifled bulletball from John Tronolone.
--> Travis Mills receiving two nutshots; one from opponent Melissa Kerr and the other from teammate Justin Wolf during Prison Ball.


Attendance of DODGEBALL C30 was 30, comprised of 19 men and 11 women.

New Players included John Cusic, Anthony Fossani, and Bianca Basilone.

DODGEBALL C30 welcomed back several of EastCoastDodgeball's finest talents: Alysha Kelly (previous DB 42); Joe Kelly (previous DB LX3); Jason Teitelbaum (previous DB 102); Chris Daly (previous DB 119); Kathryn Nogueira (previous CXX); Sara DeCuir (previous DB 122)

DODGEBALL C30 was the fourth season finale extravaganza held on the Front Courts of Wall High School. This was largely due to the continuing tennis lights failure.

The month of March has hosted 3 season finales; more than other time of the year. DODGEBALL 30 took place on March 12, 2006, while last year's DODGEBALL 80 was held on St. Patrick's Day on the 17th.

The official theme song was "Runnin' Down a Dream" by Tom Petty & the Heartbreakers.

DODGEBALL C30 was just the third ten event to feature a Rimshot Contest of any kind. DODGEBALL 50 in the Summer of 2006 and DODGEBALL LX from October of that year also featured the special pregame competition.

The captains for this milestone event were legendary figures Kevin Megill and Chris Adams. This was the first meeting between the two, despite each competing in over 100 events.
.. Kevin Megill made his third season finale captains appearance, having headlined DODGEBALL 30 and DODGEBALL 80 [both held in the month of March]. He leaves C30 with an overall 6-1-1 record, having become only the third competitor in history to reach six total victories.
.. Chris Adams also made his third season finale captains appearance, having headlined DODGEBALL 50 and DODGEBALL 70. He leaves C30 with an overall 6-6-0 record, having become the first competitor in history to lead a team into battle 12 times.

Alysha Kelly was the only competitor of the total 30 to have never competed in a ten event.

John Tronolone is now the sole combatant to participate in all 13 season finales. Kevin Adams had the streak of 12 going, but wound up missing DODGEBALL C30 due to his senior class trip.

DODGEBALL C30 not only ended the 13th ten-week program, but the Winter 2007/2008 season as well. The sport will head in to its third Spring beginning with DODGEBALL 131 on March 22.


C30 Soundtrack
Special Thanks! to both Melissa Kerr and Diana DiBuccio for the work they put forth towards the red hot playlist.

The Atmosphere
Nearly everyone in attendance helped out in setting up and taking down the decorations. Thank You all!

Now That Winter is Over ...
To everyone who participated or simply watched in awe, Thanks! for making this time period one of the most exciting ever! Over two and a half years later and we're still going strong!


The 130th EastCoastDodgeball extravaganza ... what did you think?
